revised_title: The Influence of Oxygen Dryness on Combustion of Elements
tldr: The author conducted experiments to study the influence of oxygen dryness on the combustion of various elements, such as carbon, phosphorus, and boron. They discovered that the dryness of oxygen affects the combustion process and chemical union takes place, but it does not manifest as flame. The author also discussed the combustion of amorphous phosphorus and charcoal in oxygen, as well as the possible origin of planetary systems through meteoric matter.
